treksJson.name: Sangla To Barang Trek
treksJson.attractions: Lush valleys, Gushing rivers, Soaring peaks, Wineyards
treksJson.description: Around 57Km from Kalpa is the town of Sangla also the starting of the Sangla Valley. The valley is a part of the Kinnaur district. The Sangla Valley is also known as the Baspa valley named after the Baspa River flowing through it. Tourists should spend some time at the Sangla Meadow also known as the Sangla Kanda. The area is covered with lush greenery and is surrounded by snowy peaks. The natural surroundings of snow covered peaks and clean blue sky and fresh mountain air make the Kinnaur district worth visiting.Located high up in the Himalayas, Kinnaur is also known as the Land of Fairy tales. The region of Kinnaur boasts of lush valleys, gushing rivers, soaring peaks, vineyards and lots more. Kinnaur is located on the borders of Himachal Pradesh and Tibet and a lot of Tibetan influence can be seen in the culture and lifestyle of the locals.The Kalpa village in the Kinnaur district is one of the most wonderful places in Kinnaur. From Kalpa tourists can enjoy the most stunning views of the peaks. The sunrise in Kalpa should not be missed. Kalpa is located 2758m above sea level and faces the Kinner Kailash range.
